alert.note: Alert for Gila River Valley; Southeast Yuma County (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 5:08PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A cluster of strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Yuma County through 600 PM MST... At 507 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorm near Wellton, or 15 miles east of Fortuna Foothills. These storms were nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Wellton. This includes AZ Interstate 8 between mile markers 23 and 38. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Gila River Valley; Southeast Yuma County
